description: Smallest k such that sigma(n+k) = sigma(k).
references: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 840.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe and Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (first 1001 terms from T. D. Noe).
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
prog: (PARI) A007365(m)= {local(k,n); for(k=1,m,n=1; while(sigma(n)!=sigma(n+k), n++); print1(n,","))} \\ _Klaus Brockhaus_
crossrefs: Cf. A065932, A065933. sigma(x)=A000203(x) is the sum of the divisors of x.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Mira Bernstein_, _Robert G. Wilson v_
